secret signal: If you gain only 1 Favor, gain 1 more Favor.
augury: Draw one more card. (Stop after a vision as normal.)
rusting ray: If you hold the Darkest Secret, ignore all your enemy's rolls of hollow swords.
portal: Spend no Supply and ignore the powers of sites if you're traveling to or from this site.
billowing fog: If you're defeated, kill no warbands in your force. Ignore powers that kill all of your force.
kindred warriors: Ignore all skulls you roll. Â±X Attack dice up to the number of other suits you rule.
terror spells: ACTION: Kill any two warband in your region (at sits or on boards, even yours) if you hold the Darkest Secret.
blood pact: ACTION: Sacrifice an even number of warband on your board. For every two you sacrifice, gain 1 Secret.
revelation: WHEN PLAYED, each player, following turn order, may burn any number of Favor to gain an equal number of Secrets.
observatory: While you pawn is here, you may draw from any discard pile.
plague engines: ACTION: Each player (even you) places one Favor per site they rule into the Arcane bank.
gleaming armor: Your enemy's battle plans each have an added cost of 1 Secret.
bewitch: WHEN PLAYED, if you're an Exile and have more Secrets (even on cards) than the Chancellor, you may become a Citizenâ€“ take no relic, end your Act Phase, and refresh Supply to full.
jinx: If you rule Jinx, after you roll double swords or double shields for any reason, you may use this power to reroll all those dice once. (This is not a battle plan!)
dream thief: ACTION: Swap any two facedown advisers.
cracking ground: Â± 1 Attack die per site targeted.
sealing ward: Your relics each add one more Defense die when targeted.
initiation rite: To muster, you must place 1 Secret instead of 1 Favor.
vow of silence: You cannot recover the Darkest Secret or give anyone Secrets. Whenever a player recovers it, you gain X Secrets equal to the number of Secrets they placed.
forgotten vault: ACTION: Place 1 Secret from the shared bank on the Darkest Secret, or burn 1 Secret from the Darkest Secret (not last Secret).
map library: While you pawn is at this site, you may trade with a card at any site in your region.
witch's bargain: ACTION: Give 1 Secret to a player whose pawn is at your site to take 2 favor from them, or give 2 favor for 1 Secret, any number of times.
master of disguise: Act as if you had another player's adviser instead. (You can't use your other advisers.)
great spire: You may swap any number of denizens you draw with random cards from the dispossesed.
fallen spire: You cannot use this card to muster or trade. ACTION: Sapw up to five denizens from the top of your region's discard pile (skipping visions) with random cards from the disposessed.
taming charm: ACTION: Discard a Beast of Nomad card at your site to gain 2 Favor from the matching favor bank.
spirit snare: ACTION: Take 1 Favor from any one favor bank.
fire talkers: Â± 3 Attack dice if you hold the Darkest Secret.
inquisitor: ACTION: Peek at an adviser of a player whose pawn is at your site. If it is the Conspiracy, you play it or discard it. If it is not, give them the favor here.
alchemist: ACTION: Gain 4 Favor from any favor bank or banks.
dazzle: WHEN PLAYED, discard all Hearth and Order cards at sites in your region.
magician's code: If recovering the Darkest Secret, gain 2 Secrets and add them to any other Secrets you're paying to recover it (even none).
actiong troupe: Act as if Acting Troupe is a Beast or Order card instead.
wizard school: ACTION: Gain 1 Secret, then end your Act Phase.
wild allies: ACTION: Campaign at any site with a Beast card. Act as if your pawn is there. Spend no Supply and add your warbands there to your force.
bracken: You may put all the cards you discard on the top or bottom of any one discard pile (even your region's).
vow of beastkin: You must muster on a card matching any of your advisers, but you gain one more warband.
walled garden: +1 defense die per beast card at any sites if this site is targeted.
forest council: Enemies of Forect Council's ruler cannot trade with or muster from Beast Cards
vow of poverty: You cannot gain Favor from Trade. Rest: If you have no Favor, take 2 Favor from any one bank.
marsh spirit: Players who target this site cannot use battle plans.
memeory of nature: Action: Move a total of X Favor from any favor banks to the Beast bank. X is the number of Beast cards on the map.
animal host: WHEN PLAYED, gain warbands equal to the total number of Beast cards (including Animal Host) at any sites (regardless of rule).
wild cry: If you play a Beast card, gain 1 Supply and 2 wardbands.
new growth: You may play Beast and Hearth cards to any site (that has a space).
war tortoise: Ignore all attack or defense added by your enemy's rolls of Double Sword or Double Shield. (Any Skulls they roll still kill their warbands.)
giant python: Whenever a player attacks you, they must declare targets that add an even total (2, 4, etc.) of Defense Dies to your defense pool.
vow of union: In campaigns, warbands at sites you rule add to your attacking force. You cannot travel from a site you rule if any warbands are on your board.
insect swarm: Your enemy's battle plans each have and added cost of Burn 1 Favor.
pied piper: This card ignores the Adviser limit. ACTION: Move this card to any other player's advisers. Take 2 favor from them.
second chance: ACTION: Kill one warband on the baord of a player who has an Order or Discord adviser to gain one warband.
fae merchant: ACTION: Draw a relic and take it. Put any relic you hold except the Grand Scepter on the bottom of the relic deck.
threatening roar: WHEN PLAYED, discard all Nomad and Beast cards at sites in your region.
grasping vines: Enemies traveling from any site ruled by Grasping Vines' ruler must kill one warband on their board if able.
small friends: Act as if your pawn is at any site with a Beast card. (You may use trade modifiers there.)
birdsong: Spend no Supply if you're trading with a Beast or Nomad card.
nature worship: Â± 1 Attack die per Beast Adviser you have.
forest temple: In the Chronicle, do not discard sites with any Beast cards.
wolves: ACTION: Kill one warband (even yours) on any one board.
forest paths: Spend no Supply and ignore the powers of sites if you're traveling to a site with a Beast card.
animal playmates: Spend no Supply if you're mustering on a Beast card.
errand boy: You may draw from a discard pile in a different region instead of yours.
the old oak: If trading with The Old Oak for a Secret, gain one more Secret if you have any Beast advisers.
long-lost heir: WHEN PLAYED, if you're an Exile, you may become a Citizenâ€“ take no relic, end your Act Phase, and refresh Supply to full (leftmost).
roving terror: ACTION: Discard a denizen card at any other site and move this card there.
true names: Your enemy cannot use battle plans that match any of your advisers against you.
rangers: Ignore all skulls you roll. + 2 Attack dice if the defense pool has 4+ defense dice.
mushrooms: Spend no Supply, but draw only one card (not three) from the bottom of your region's discard pile.
riots: WHEN PLAYED, if the People's Favor is on the Mob side, discard all other cards of the most common suit on the map. If there is a tie, you choose among the tied suits.
silver tongue: You can only have two advisers. REST: Take Favor from a favor bank matching a card at your site.
gambling hall: ACTION: Roll 4 Defense dice and take X Favor equal to the total shield result from any one favor bank.
boiling lake: If you travel to this site and do not rule this card, you must kill two warbands on your board if able.
relic thief: After a player take any relics and their pawn is in your region, you may use this power to roll one Defense die per relic taken. If you roll no shields, take the relics.
enchantress: Swap this card with any one faceup adviser.
insomnia: You can only have two advisers. REST: Gain 1 Secret.
sneak attack: After another player's campaign, you may campaign, spending no Supply, if you declare them as the defender.
gossip: Enemies of Gossip's ruler cannot play cards as facedown advisers.
bandit thief: WHEN PLAYED, kill one warband at each site. While Bandit Chief is faceup, each site has two more bandits.
chaos cult: After another player takes the Oathkeeper title, you take 1 Favor from them.
slander: If you're victorious and targeted the defender's pawn, they burn all of the favor on their board.
charlatan: WHEN PLAYED, burn all Favor but one from the Darkest Secret.
assassin: You can only have two advisers. ACTION: Discard a faceup adviser of a player whose pawn is at your site.
downtrodden: Gain two more warbands if mustering on a card whose favor bank has the least Favor (not tied).
blackmail: WHEN PLAYED, choose a relic held by a player whose pawn is at your site. You take the relic unless they give you 3 Favor.
cracked sage: Â± 4 Attack dice if youyr enemy has an Arcane adviser.
dissent: WHEN PLAYED, each player, expecpt the holder of the People's Favor, places 1 Favor on this card for each suit of card they rule.
false prophet: WHEN PLAYED, if you're an Exile , gain one warband and put it on any revealed Vision. You now also have it revealed. If it is ever discarded, kill the warband and play or discard the vision as if you searched.
vow of renewal: You cannot recover the People's Favor. Whenever any player burns Favor, you take the Favor instead.
zealots: If the defending force is larger than your force, each warband you sacrifice will add three (not one) to your attack.
royal ambitions: WHEN PLAYED, if you're an Exile and rule more sites than the Chancellor, you may become a Citizenâ€“ take any one Reliquary relic without peeking, end your Act Phase, and refresh Supply to full.
salt the earth: You cannot play Salt the Earth to a site with any locked cards. WHEN PLAYED, ignore this sites capacity. Discard all other denizens at this site. This site's capacity is now 1.
beast tamer: Enemies cannot use Beast or Nomad battle plans against you.
festival district: ACTION: Negotiate a binding exchange of Favor, Secrets, and advisers with any player.
squalid district: You cannot use this card to muster or trade. Whenever the purple die is roled to end the game, Squalid District's ruler may increase of decrease this roll by one. Citizens cannot use this power.
sleight of hand: ACTION: Take 1 Secret from a player whose pawn is at your site. You cannot take their last Secret.
key to the city: WHEN PLAYED, if the ruler's pawn is not at this site, kill any warbands at this site, then gain a warband and placed it here.
naysayers: REST: If any Exile is the Oathkeeper or Usurper, take 1 Favor from the Chancellor.
book burning: If you're victorious and targeted the defender's pawn, they also burn all of the Secrets on their board except their last.
second wind: After you're victorious, you may travel and then may campaign, spending no Supply for either.
disgraced captain: + 4 Attack dice if targeting a site that has an Order card.
mercanaries: Â± 3 Attack dice. If you're defeated while using this power, discard Mercenaries.
scryer: ACTION: Peek at any one discard pile.
vow of peace: You cannot campaign. Attackers cannot sacrifice warbands to increase their attack against you.
deed writer: ACTION: Negoitiate a binding exchange of Favor, Secrets, and ruled sites with any player. Old ruler moves warbands to baord, and new ruler moves warbands from board.
salad days: WHEN PLAYED, gain 3 Favorâ€“ one from three diverent Favor banks.
marriage: Marriage counts as two Hearth advisers, but only counts as one toward your adviser limit.
hospital: If any of your warbands would be killed, place them on Hospital's site instead if you still rule it.
awaited return: Spend no Supply if you sacrifice one warband on your board.
homesteaders: ACTION: Move one of your faceup advisers to your site.
crop rotation: If played to a site, you may first discard a denizen there.
a round of ale: ACTION: Return all Favor and Secrets, and flip your Secret, as in the Rest Phase, except for the Favor here.
land warden: You may play two cards you draw (instead of one) if you play at least one card to a site.
charming friend: ACTION: Take 1 Favor from a player whose pawn is at your site.
village constabel: Â± 2 Attack dice unless your enemy has the People's Favor.
family heirloom: WHEN PLAYED, draw a relic. Take it or put it on the bottom of the relic deck.
levelers: ACTION: Move 2 Favor from the favor bank with the most Favor to that with the least favor. You decide ties.
fabled feast: WHEN PLAYED, take X Favor equal to the number of Hearth cards you rule (including Fabled Feast), from any one favor bank.
the great levy: Â± 3 Attack dice and ignore all skulls you roll, unless your enemy has the Peopl's Favor.
hearts and minds: As defender, you're victorious now. At end, discard Hearts and Minds unless you hold the People's Favor.
relic breaker: ACTION: Put the facedown relic at your site on the bottom of the relic deck to gain three warbands.
book binders: After another player plays a Vision faceup, you gain 2 Favor from any one favor bank.
ballot box: ACTION: If you're an Exile and have the People's Favor, become a Citizenâ€“ take no relic, end your Act Phase, and refresh Supply to full.
saddle makers: After another player plays a Nomad or Order card, you gain 2 Favor from the matching favor bank.
herald: After another player campaigns again a player (not bandits), you gain 1 Favor from any favor bank.
rowdy pub: Gain one more warband if mustering from Rowdy Pub.
hall of debate: Players cannot target the People's Favor.
hall of mockery: You cannot use this card to muster or trade. Recovering the People's Favor always flips it to the Mob side.
tinker's fair: ACTION: Negotiate a binding exchange of Favor, Secrets, and advisers with any player.
welcoming party: If you play a denizen card that was not a facedown adviser, gain 1 Favor from the Hearth bank.
memory of home: ACTION: Move all Favor form any one favor bank to the Hearth bank.
storyteller: ACTION: Place 1 Secret from the shared bank on the Darkest Secret.
armed mob: ACTION: Discard a faceup adviser from a player who holds the Darkest Secret but not the People's Favor.
tavern songs: ACTION: Peek at the top three cards of your region's discard pile.
traveling doctor: If you're defeated, kill no warbands in your force and discard Traveling Doctor. Ignore powers that kill all of your force.
convoys: ACTION: Take another region's discard pile and put it on top of your region's discard pile (even if empty).
vow of kinship: Move all of your Favor to the Nomad bank. Any Favor you gain or take is put in the Nomad bank.You can use Favor in the Nomad Bank as if it is on your board.
wild mounts: If you would discard any number of Nomad battle plans, you may instead discard any one Beast card you rule.
lancers: Double your total attack roll. At end, discard Lancers.
mountain giant: Â± 1 Attack die OR Â± 3 Attack dice and at end, discard.
rival khan: Â± 4 Attack dice if your enemy has a Nomad advisor. At end, discard Rival Khan.
lost tongue: Other players cannot target or take your relics or banners in any way unless they rule a Nomad card.
special envoy: Spend no Supply. After traveling, end your Act Phase.
resettle: ACTION: Move any faceup Nomad card from any player's advisers to any site.
oracle: ACTION: Draw the Vision closest to the top of the world deck. Play or discard it as if you searched.
pilgrimage: WHEN PLAYED, move all denizens at your site to the Dispossessed. Shuffle and draw denizens from the dispossessed equal to the number you moved. Peek at them and put them on your region's discard pile.
spell breaker: Enemies of Spell Breaker's ruler cannot use powers that cost and Secrets or burnt Secrets.
mounted patrol: The attacker rolls only hald the Attack dice in their attack pool, rounded down. At end, discard Mounted Patrol.
great crusade: Â± 1 Attack die per Nomad card you rule. At end, discard Great Crusade.
ancient bloodline: Your enemies act as if denizens and relics at sites you rule are LOCKED.
ancient pact: WHEN PLAYED, you may give the Chancellor the Darkest Secret to become a Citizenâ€“ take any one Religuary relic without peeking, end your Act Phase, and refresh Supply to full.
storm caller: + 2 Defense dice. At end, discard Storm Caller.
family wagon: You can only have one adviser that is not a Nomad. You can have any number of Nomad advisersâ€“ they ignore your adviser limit.
way station: Spend no Supply if you're traveling to this site and either rule Way Station or choose to give 1 Favor to its ruler. (Give it to Chancellor if Empire, burn it if bandits.)
twin brother: WHEN PLAYED, you may swap this card with a faceup Nomad adviser of another player.
hospitality: After traveling, gain Favor from one favor bank that mathces both a card at your site and one of your advisers.
a fast steed: Spend no Supply if you have three of fewer wardbands on your board.
relic worship: After you recover a relic, gain 3 supply.
sacred ground: Players cannot play Visions, except the Consipiracy, faceup unless their pawn is at this site.
ancient forge: ACTION: Draw a relic. Take it or put it on the bottom of the relic deck.
broken forge: You cannot use this card to muster or trade. ACTION: Flip this card over.
ancient binding: ACTION: Each player burns all Secrets from their board and cards except their last secret. (Keep only your secret here.)
horse archers: Â± 3 Attack dice. At end, discard Horse Archers.
tents: Spend no Supply if you're traveling to a site in your region.
warning signals: Move any warbands to and from your board and any sites you rule (except the last warband from a site). At end, discard Warning Signals.
great herd: When PLAYED, you may swap the Great Herd with a Nomad card at any site.
the gathering: WHEN PLAYED, any players in turn order may put their pawn on this site. Then, players with pawns here may negotiate binding exchanges of Favor, Secrets, relics, and advisers.
rain boots: Ignore all your enemy's rolls of single shields. At end, discard Rain Boots.
code of honor: Â± 2 Attack dice but you cannot use other battle plans.
messenger: ACTION: Move any wardbands to and from your board and any sites you rule (except the last warband from a site).
field promotion: If you are victorious, gain three warbands.
palanquin: ACTION: Chose a player whose pawn is at your site. Put your pawn on a site that they can travel to. Make them travel to that site, spending no Supply.
shield wall: + 2 Defense dice. If you're defeated, kill all of your force.
military parade: If you're victorious, gain 1 Favor from the favor banks matching each adviser of your enemy (including Imperial Allies).
tome guardians: Enemies of Tome Guardians' ruler cannot target or take the Darkest Secret in any way.
tyrant: You must kill a warband (even your own) at the site you travel to, if able.
forced labor: Enemies cannot search if their pawn is at any site ruled by Forced Labor's ruler unless they give 1 Favor to its ruler. (Give it to the Chancellor if Empire, burn it if Bandits.)
secret police: Enemies cannot play Visions faceup while their pawn is at any site ruled by Secret Police's ruler.
specialist: The defender cannot use battle plans.
captains: ACTION: Campaign at any site you rule. Act as if your pawn is there. Spend no Supply and add your warbands there to your force.
siege engines: ACTION: Kill two warbands (even yours) at any one site in your region.
royal tax: WHEN PLAYED, take 2 Favor from each player whose pawn is at a site you rule.
toll roads: Enemies cannot travel to sites ruled by Toll Roads' ruler unless they give 1 Favor to its ruler. (Give it to the Chancellor if Empire, burn it if Bandits.)
curfew: Enemies cannot trade with cards ruled by Curfew's ruler unless they give 1 Favor to its ruler. (Give it to the Chancellor if Empire, burn it if Bandits.)
knights errant: After mustering, you may campaign, spending no Supply.
vow of obedience: You cannot play Visions faceup. REST: Take 1 Favor from any one favor bank.
hunting party: After searching the world deck, you may campaign, spending no supply.
council seat: If you're a Citizen, you cannot be excited, even by yourself.
encirclement: Â± 2 Attack dice if your force is larger than your enemy's.
peace envoy: You cannot use other battle plans. If your enemy's pawn is at your site, give them one Favor per defense die in the pool. You're victorious now. Ignore killing warbands.
relic hunter: You may target facedown relics at targeted sites, adding 1 Defense die per relic. You may put any relics you take on the bottom of the relic deck.
sprawling rampart: Each site ruled by Sprawling Rampart's ruler adds one more Defense die when targeted.
bandit rampart: -2 Attacker dice if this site is targeted
wrestlers: +1 Defense die if you sacrifice one warband in your force.
battle honor: If you're victorious, gain 2 Favor from the Order bank.
keep: +2 Defense dice if this site is targeted.
garrison: WHEN PLAYED, gain one warband per site you rule, and put one warband from your board on each site you rule.
bear traps: - 1 Attack die. Kill one warband on the attacker's board.
pressgangs: You can muster on cards that already have Favor or Secrets on them.
martial culture: If you're an exile and defeat another Exile, you may become a Citizenâ€“ take no relic, end your Act Phase, and refresh Supply to full (leftmost).
ruined temple: You cannot use this card to muster or trade. Enemies of Ruined Temple's ruler cannot play Beast cards faceup.
vision of conquest: WAKE: You win if you rule the most sites and at least three Visions have been drawn from the deck.
vision of sanctuary: WAKE: You win if you hold the most relics and banners, and at the least three Visions have been drawn from the deck.
vision of faith: WAKE: You win if you hold the Darkest Secret and at least three Visions have been drawn from the deck.
vision of rebellion: WAKE: You win if you hold the People's Favor and at least three Visions have been drawn from the deck.
conspiracy: WHEN PLAYED: You may burn 1 Secret to take one relic or banner from a player whose pawn is at your site. Trigger its WHEN SEIZED if it's a banner. To do so, you must have at least two advisers whose suits match any of their advisers. Return this card to the box.
ivory eye: ACTION: Peek at any facedown site, adivser, or relic at a site.
ring of devotion: You cannot place warbands at sites. When mustering, you gain two more warbands.
whistle: ACTION: Chose a pwan at another site. They must travel to your site if able, spending no Supply. If they do, give them the Secret here.
cracked horn: You may put all the cards you discard on the bottom of the world deck.
obsidian cage: If you're victorious, move all unkilled warbands in your enemy's force to Obsidian Cage. ACTION: Move any number of warbands from Obsidian Cage to any board of the same color.
sticky fire: If you're victorious, you may kill all the warband in your enemy's force. If you do, you must give them 1 Favor if able.
cursed cauldron: If you're victorious, gain one warband per enemy warband killed in this campaign.
brass horse: ACTION: Reveal the top card of your discard pile. Travel to a site with a card of this suit. If unable, travel as normal. In either case, spend no Supply.
truthful harp: You may draw two more cards. If you do, you must reveal every card you draw and the card you keep.
grand mask: If you're an Exile, during your turn you rule cards except battle plans at Imperial sites, and Imperial players do not.
horned mask: ACTION: Swap one of your faceup advisers with a card at your site.
cup of plenty: Spend no Supply if you're trading with a card that matches any of your advisers.
dowsing sticks: ACTION: Draw a relic. Take it or put it on the bottom of the relic deck.
bandit crown: Act as if bandits are your warbands except at sites ruled by enemies. (You rule empty sites.) They cannot be killed, moved, or sacrificed.
skeleton key: ACTION: If the Chancellor rules your site, peek at any one relice in the Imperial Reliquary, and you may take it.
oracular pig: ACTION: Peek at the top three cards of the world deck.
circlet of command: Players cannot target or take your banners or your other relics. In campaigns, banishing your pawn and favor adds one more Defense die.
map: ACTION: Put this relic on the bottom of the relic deck to gain 4 Supply.
book of records: You must gain 1 Secret instead of 1 Favor when you play to a site.
